lines.text: one person's interminable stretch of highway is--
Is another person's road to adventure, I know. But going out of our way to see a giant ice-cream cone? That's crazy.
Crazy? Crazy is NOT to see the giant ice-cream cone. How'd you like to tell your friends we were in Baxter--Oh, didja see the giant ice-cream cone? No, we missed it. THAT would be crazy.
So, do you guys wanna party at the aqueduct tonight?
Nah.
Aw, c'mon, you guys!
The only party I heard about is the one in your panties.
Oh, no. There's absolutely no way there could be a party in my panties.
Why not?
Because I'm not wearing any.
[first lines]
Come on Blue, it's easy money. Billy said 10 bucks an hour, man. That's some cash. The way I figure it, we can make at least a hundred bucks a day fixin' up the motel.

[to Blue]
Did you just compare yourself to Noah?
I wonder how long it's gonna take them to find our bodies.

Oh, probably never. You know, that's assuming they'd even look. You know how many bodies are buried out here they've never found? San Bernardino Sheriff's Office told me that if all the dead bodies in the dessert stood up at the same time, this place would resemble Manhattan.
No cable?
I tried get it, but they actually wanted me to pay for 45 miles cable.
Gee, sounds like a satellite dish would be cheaper.
Yes, but then the aliens would know where we are.
You guys want to get cremated or buried?
I don't care, what ever. Bury me, burn me, why does it matter?
It matters. I don't want to rot in a box... bugs and worms and weird animals eat out my eyeballs.
I want to rot in a box.
What's wrong? We're okay.
I know. Just having a fun time dying with you.
You haven't seen Agent Bellows, have you?
No, I haven't.
I can't find him anywhere.
Have you tried calling him on that cellular surveillance phone?
I've tried, but he's not picking up.
Well, I was thinking he's been abducted. Of course, it would be an odd choice.
I can blow up your dad's car. Then you can stay longer.
Thanks.
So, now that we know everything, what do you say we just pretend that we know nothing...
[last lines]

[heading off to see Ely's latest explosion]
Oh, she's in for it now.
